original_title: Wiring An SD card To A Handspring PDA’s 68K Bus With Only Three SOT23s
original_content:
In 1998 the founders of Palm had a bit of a falling out with the wildly successful PDA companys new owners. They set up a new company called Handspring, which enabled them to make PDAs again in the way they preferred, This resulted in the Handspring Visor line of PDAs, which featured a big cartridge slot called the Springboard Expansion slot. Much like a Gameboy, you could put in a range of modules, ranging from games to cameras to memory expansion and more. Since these modules connect directly to the internal Motorola 68k-based microprocessor, you could make a module either to comply with this standard or if youre like [Dmitry], youd figure out a way to get an SPI device like an SD card to communicate and expand storage.
Editor note: Dmitrys design isnt the first SD/MMC interface for the Visor. Portable Innovation Technologys SD MemPlug Module supported SD/MMC way back in 2002. However  MemPlug was a commercial product, while Dmitrys work is open source.

Schematic of Dmitris SpringSD board for Handspring Visor PDAs.
To make the M68k bus traffic look somewhat SPI-like to an SPI slave, a CS signal had to be generated using a 74LVC1G80GW D-type flipflop, with the same flipflop also used on the address line for MOSI to keep this stable on the side of the SD card. Finally, an inverter (74HCT1G04GW) was added for the clock signal, making for three SOT-23 packages total. All that was required now was a driver to use this custom board. Once the driver was done, [Dmitri] was able to use the SD card in the PalmOS file manager.
As also noted by [Dmitri], this is not the way to make a Handspring-approved Springboard cartridge, but he provides the documentation to make one that does. Despite the short lifespan of the Visor range of PDAs with this slot, it nevertheless saw positive reviews and a range of cartridges released. If you still have an old visor around, why not use it to control a robot arm!
title: "Handspring Visor: ゲームやカメラなどのモジュールを追加できるPDA"
body: 1998年、Palmの創業者たちはPDA会社の新しいオーナーとの不和に直面しました。そこで彼らはHandspringという新しい会社を立ち上げ、好みのやり方で再びPDAを作ることができました。その結果、Handspring Visorと呼ばれるPDAシリーズが生まれ、大きなカートリッジスロットを備えていました。ゲームからカメラまで、さまざまなモジュールを挿入することができます。Dmitryなどの人々はSPIデバイス（例えばSDカード）を接続してストレージを拡張する方法を見つけました。
